title: incorrect shape in  translating "ConvTranspose2d"  to ONNX
body_html:
• OS: MacOS
  • PyTorch version: pytorch 0.3.0 py27_cuda0.0_cudnn0.0he480db7_4
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Python version: Python 2.7.14
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: NA
  • GPU models and configuration: NA
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): NA

I wrote a simple test to test export of "ConvTranspose2d" to ONNX:

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
from torch.autograd import Variable
import torch.onnx as torch_onnx
import mxnet as mx
import onnx

class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
    self.c0 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(1024, 512, 4, 2, 1, bias=False)

    def forward(self, inputs):
        return self.c0(inputs)

input_shape = (1, 1024, 100, 100)
model_onnx_path = "convTranspose_model.onnx"

model = Model()
model.train(False)

dummy_input = Variable(torch.randn(input_shape))
torch_onnx.export(model, dummy_input, model_onnx_path, verbose=True)


model = onnx.load('convTranspose_model.onnx')
onnx.checker.check_model(model)

If I view the onnx graph in Netron, the shape of the "W" seems incorrect.
The expected shape : (512,1024, 4,4)
but it shows as: (1024, 512, 4, 4)

body:
- OS: MacOS
- PyTorch version: pytorch                   0.3.0           py27_cuda0.0_cudnn0.0he480db7_4    
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
- Python version:  Python 2.7.14
- CUDA/cuDNN version: NA
- GPU models and configuration: NA
- GCC version (if compiling from source): NA

 I wrote a simple test to test export of "ConvTranspose2d" to ONNX:


```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
from torch.autograd import Variable
import torch.onnx as torch_onnx
import mxnet as mx
import onnx

class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
    self.c0 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(1024, 512, 4, 2, 1, bias=False)

    def forward(self, inputs):
        return self.c0(inputs)

input_shape = (1, 1024, 100, 100)
model_onnx_path = "convTranspose_model.onnx"

model = Model()
model.train(False)

dummy_input = Variable(torch.randn(input_shape))
torch_onnx.export(model, dummy_input, model_onnx_path, verbose=True)


model = onnx.load('convTranspose_model.onnx')
onnx.checker.check_model(model)
```

If I view the onnx graph in  Netron, the shape of the "W"  seems incorrect. 
The expected shape :  (512,1024, 4,4)
but it shows as: (1024, 512, 4, 4)
